image.altText: Puffer fish Kangaroo Island

props.synopsis: Storms earlier this week could have broken up an algal bloom that has led to a huge number of marine wildlife deaths off South Australia.

title.children: Falling ocean temperatures off SA coast bring hope for end of toxic algal bloom

image.altText: A smiling, middle-aged man in a dark suit poses for a corporate-style headshot.

props.synopsis: A South Australian councillor says he will appeal to the ombudsman after colleagues called on him to quit his position for refusing to acknowledge Welcome to Country ceremonies.

title.children: Councillor refuses to resign after Welcome to Country snub

image.altText: A police vehicle on the far side of the road

props.synopsis: South Australian police say a man is in hospital after he became unresponsive while being arrested in Adelaide's east in the early hours of Thursday morning.

title.children: Man in hospital after becoming unresponsive during attempted arrest, SA Police say

image.altText: A man wearing a dark shirt stands outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: A charge of using a Nazi symbol has been dropped against National Socialist Network leader Thomas Sewell.

title.children: Charges dropped for Nazi symbol use at Australia Day gathering

image.altText: A road train drives down a road underneath orange street lights. Shops line the street.

props.synopsis: As the SA government prepares to hand down its last budget before a state election, it recognises a need to build a bypass to take trucks off Adelaide roads â€” but how much is it willing to spend?

title.children: Long-awaited Adelaide freight bypass hits crossroad in funding tussle

image.altText: Emergency vehicles near the wreckage of a truck and other destroyed vehicles on a stretch of highway in the countryside.

props.synopsis: A multi-vehicle crash on the Western Highway in Victoria has been described by police as "absolute carnage".

title.children: Two Victorians, SA man identified as victims of highway crash

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: A coroner has called for SA Police to change its operating practices after a "high need detainee requiring medical attention" deteriorated while he was left alone in his cell for 41 minutes, after officers decided he needed an ambulance.

title.children: Detainee left alone in cell suffers cardiac arrest waiting for ambulance

image.altText: A dry paddock in south west victoria

props.synopsis: Drought-stricken parts of southern Australia, including Melbourne and Adelaide, are bracing for an increased spike in bushfire risk this winter, according to a new report.

title.children: Dried-out southern regions face increased winter fire risk

image.altText: A composit image of an aerial of a flooded landscape and an image of dry landcape with a lone tree.

props.synopsis: There are signs a major climate driver could shift into its "wet phase" over the coming months, boosting the chance of rain across large parts of Australia toward the end of winter.

title.children: BOM's winter outlook gives clues as to whether rain will fall where it's needed

image.altText: Elon Musk stands in front of a screen and waves.

props.synopsis: A proposal to build a Tesla factory in Adelaide's south is one step closer, despite 95 per cent of respondents to the local council's public consultation opposing the plan.

title.children: Council progresses plan for Tesla battery factory, despite 'anti-Elon' sentiment

image.altText: Identical twins Danny and Michael Philippou pose for a photo, making funny faces in front of a neutral background.

props.synopsis: Aussie directors Danny and Michael Philippou are behind the $143 million smash-hit Talk to Me, but they won't be switching Adelaide for Hollywood. Now they're back with a gory new feature, once again exploring the horrors of teen life in suburbia.

title.children: Why Aussie directors behind $143m smash-hit won't be moving to Hollywood

image.altText: A woman in a hooded jacket covers her face after a court appearance.

props.synopsis: A manslaughter charge has been dropped against a South Australian woman over the death of her six-year-old daughter. Instead, she has pleaded guilty to three charges of criminal neglect. WARNING:Â Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains the first name and image of a person who hasÂ died.

title.children: SA mother pleads guilty to criminal neglect over death of 6yo daughter

image.altText: A drone picture of Adelaide's Sam Way building, with other CBD buildings nearby.

props.synopsis: A former senior member of a South Australian church has been jailed and told he "should've known better" when he sexually assaulted a 14-year-old girl in the early 2000s.

title.children: 'Should've known better': Former senior church member sentenced for teen sex assault

image.altText: Doctors and nurses in a surgical theatre operate on an unseen patient.

props.synopsis: The flow-on effects of private health provider Healthscope's financial woes are not only affecting patients â€” it's feared they could add to the exodus of much-needed doctors from regional areas.

title.children: Ripples felt around Australia because of Healthscope collapse

image.altText: A man surrounded by emergency service workers holding a blanket and plastic bags.

props.synopsis: Emergency services have rescued a man from the bottom of a deep cave in the centre of a regional South Australian city.

title.children: Man pulled to safety after getting stuck in 30m deep sinkhole

image.altText: Man with black hat and grey shirt with arm around a brown pony as it eats from a bucket.

props.synopsis: South Australian farmers say "there's no hay" in the state, and where it is available, it has reached unsustainable prices amid ongoing drought conditions.

title.children: 'No hay' in South Australia casting doubt over farming future

image.altText: Liberal leader Sussan Ley and Nationals leader David Littleproud.

props.synopsis: Coalition leaders have made clear the pledge to lower emissions to net zero by 2050 is on the table, as the Liberal Party reviews its policies after its disastrous election defeat.

title.children: The Coalition is reviewing its net zero pledge. Some Liberals are alarmed

image.altText: Liberal Senator Andrew Bragg

props.synopsis: Andrew Bragg also promises a focus on small businesses and private sector investment in his newly created productivity and deregulation shadow portfolios.

title.children: Liberals to shift housing focus from buyer incentives and urban sprawl

image.altText: A woman wearing a purple patterned scarf stands in a park in front of cardboard cut out people.

title.children: Comedian Magda Szubanski reveals 'very aggressive' cancer diagnosis

image.altText: A drone view of a settlement with rows of houses and roads.

image.altText: A sketch of Erin Patterson wearing a blue jumper and thin framed black glasses with her hair tied back.

title.children: Trump, tariffs and the Middle East are looming challenges for Albanese

image.altText: Two bouquets of flowers and a cardboard sign reading #lifematters on the ground

title.children: Lidia Thorpe calls governments 'complicit' after death of young man

image.altText: A woman in a striped yellow top sits with her hands clasped under her chin

title.children: Woman who sold six-year-old daughter jailed for life in South Africa

image.altText: Jade Young, 47, was fatally stabbed at Westfield Bondi Junction on Saturday, April 13, 2024

title.children: Loved ones of Bondi stabbing victim 'hurt so terribly' after loss

image.altText: A surveillance image of a man carrying a TV into a shop

props.synopsis: A man who murdered his elderly mother with a 15kg pot plant before selling her belongings for drug money has been jailed for at least 21 years.

title.children: Man who murdered elderly mum with pot plant sentenced to 21 years jail
